Name: titanium sponge production, from titanium tetrachloride | titanium sponge | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/24:Manufacture of basic metals/242:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals/2420:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals
Description: After the production of high-purity TiCl4, it enters the reduction and distillation process, where it is firstly reduced by adding magnesium and then vacuum-distilled, producing the so-called titanium sponge and magnesium chloride as a byproduct based on the following stoichiometric equation: TiCl4 + 2Mg -> Ti + 2MgCl2. The magnesium chloride is then separated via the electrolysis process (modelled in a separate activity) and produces magnesium and chlorine. After refining, the magnesium is recycled and serves again as input to the reduction and distillation process, while chlorine (after it is filtrated and purified) is recycled and sent back to the chlorination process as an input.
